filmography.title: Odd Man Out
filmography.role_description: A wounded Irish revolutionary leader who wanders the streets of Belfast while trying to evade the police after a botched robbery.
filmography.plot: A wounded Irish nationalist leader attempts to escape the police following a robbery in Belfast, but is abandoned by his gang and left to wander the city's streets.

filmography.title: The Desert Fox: The Story of Rommel
filmography.role_description: The celebrated German Field Marshal who becomes disillusioned with Hitler and joins a plot to assassinate him.
filmography.plot: The story of the final years of the respected World War II German general, Erwin Rommel, and his involvement in the conspiracy against Hitler.

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: A noble Roman senator who, driven by his love for the Republic, is manipulated into joining the conspiracy to assassinate his friend Caesar.
filmography.plot: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar leads a group of Roman senators to plot his assassination, sparking a civil war.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: A Star Is Born
filmography.role_description: A fading, alcoholic movie star who discovers and mentors a young singer, marrying her as her career ascends while his own collapses.
filmography.plot: A movie star helps a young singer and actress find fame, even as age and alcoholism send his own career into a downward spiral.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Musical/Comedy)

filmography.title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
filmography.role_description: The brilliant but fanatical captain of the submarine Nautilus who wages a private war against warships and humanity's brutality.
filmography.plot: A ship sent to investigate a wave of mysterious sinkings encounters the advanced submarine Nautilus, commanded by the mysterious Captain Nemo.

filmography.title: Bigger Than Life
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered schoolteacher who becomes addicted to a new miracle drug (cortisone), which causes him to develop psychotic and megalomaniacal delusions.
filmography.plot: A schoolteacher and family man suffers a psychotic break and threatens his family after becoming addicted to cortisone prescribed for a painful artery disease.

filmography.title: North by Northwest
filmography.role_description: A suave, charming, and ruthless foreign spy who kidnaps an advertising executive he mistakes for a government agent.
filmography.plot: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and falls for a woman whose loyalties he begins to doubt.

filmography.title: Lolita
filmography.role_description: A middle-aged European professor who becomes obsessed with the 14-year-old daughter of his landlady.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged college professor becomes infatuated with a fourteen-year-old nymphet.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Drama); BAFTA: Nomination – Best Actor

filmography.title: Georgy Girl
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, middle-aged businessman who proposes a mistress arrangement to the young, unconventional daughter of his butler.
filmography.plot: A misfit fights for happiness in the world of swinging London.

filmography.title: Heaven Can Wait
filmography.role_description: A heavenly escort and bureaucrat who tries to rectify a mistake when a pro quarterback is taken to the afterlife prematurely.
filmography.plot: A Los Angeles Rams quarterback, accidentally taken away from his body by an overanxious angel before he was meant to die, returns to life in the body of a recently murdered millionaire.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Verdict
filmography.role_description: A powerful, highly paid, and unscrupulous defense attorney who uses every legal trick to defeat a washed-up lawyer in a medical malpractice suit.
filmography.plot: A lawyer sees the chance to salvage his career and self-respect by taking a medical malpractice case to trial rather than settling.
